content: There are 10 birds on a tree. A hunter shoots one bird. How many birds remain on the tree?

Let's see. There are 10 birds on a tree, and a hunter shoots one bird. The question is, how many birds remain on the tree?

At first glance, it seems straightforward. If there were 10 birds and one was shot, then 9 birds should remain. But wait, hunters are known for being stealthy and skilled, so maybe there's more to this.

Perhaps the sound of the gunshot would scare away the other birds. So, if one bird is shot, the others might fly away out of fear. In that case, maybe no birds remain on the tree.

On the other hand, maybe the birds are so focused on whatever they're doing that they don't notice the shot, or perhaps the tree is far enough from the hunter that the sound doesn't reach them in time to make them fly away.

Alternatively, maybe only some of the birds fly away after the shot, not all of them. It depends on how close the hunter is and how loud the gunshot is.

Also, considering the scenario, if the hunter shoots and misses, that could still scare the birds away. But the question says the hunter shoots one bird, which implies that he hits one bird.
